DataElement.preferredName: Patient Pathologic Confirmation Adult T-Cell Leukemia/Lymphoma Chemotherapy Received Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if the patient has received chemotherpay for the pathologically confirmed peripheral (mature) T-cell neoplasm linked to the human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Pathologic Confirmation Adult T-Cell Leukemia/Lymphoma Chemotherapy Received Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._Having been established or verified._A peripheral (mature) T-cell neoplasm linked to the human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1).  Adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma is endemic in several regions of the world, in particular Japan, the Caribbean, and parts of Central Africa._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._To take, accept, or get something offered._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Pathologic Confirmation Adult T-Cell Leukemia/Lymphoma Chemotherapy Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Having been established or verified.:A peripheral (mature) T-cell neoplasm linked to the human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1).  Adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma is endemic in several regions of the world, in particular Japan, the Caribbean, and parts of Central Africa.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

A peripheral (mature) T-cell neoplasm linked to the human T-cell leukemia virus type 1 (HTLV-1).  Adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma is endemic in several regions of the world, in particular Japan, the Caribbean, and parts of Central Africa.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has acute or lymph
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has acute or lymphoma forms has patient received at least one cycle of combination chemotherapy (with or without mogamulizumab) or interferon (with or without zidovudine and/or arsenic)?
